thread.title: Alec Baldwin's 'Saturday Night Live' episode hits ratings high, targets American politics

author: chron.com
title: Alec Baldwin's 'Saturday Night Live' episode hits ratings high, targets American politics
text:

Photo: Getty Images / SNL Screenshot Alec Baldwin's 'Saturday Night Live' episode hits ratings high, targets American politics 1 / 6 Back to Gallery Alec Baldwin broke the record for the number of episodes hosted by a single person following Saturday's "Saturday Night Live" episode - and millions of Americans tuned in as Baldwin and the cast targeted American politics.
From targeting real-life issues to rumored relationships, the "SNL" episode didn't fail to give the American audience a show over the weekend.
RECORD-BREAKING: 'SNL' hits 6-year TV ratings high
But the audience's loyalty this season - which has seen a 22 percent jump in viewership compared to past seasons - could be attributed to the expertly crafted makeup that's used to transform the actors and actresses into various political faces.
In Saturday night's episode, actress Melissa McCarthy transformed into White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer, Actress Kate McKinnon converted to Jeff Sessions, Kellyanne Conway and Senator Elizabeth Warren.
One week after unveiling her withering impersonation of White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer on Saturday Night Live, Melissa McCarthy returned to Studio 8H for another round of mockery
Media: People ADVANCE TECH: 'Saturday Night Live' launches first-ever Snapchat show
And naturally, Baldwin protruded his lips to become Trump. Click through the gallery above to see the transformation each actor took to become the political figure on Saturday's episode of "SNL."
